page.title: 03POLLUTION
page.content: {POLLUTION:} Lough Neagh provides drinking water for hundreds of thousands of people.Scientists at the Freshwater Biological Investigation Unit,at Greenmount Agricultural College,Antrim have been monitoring the growth rate of algae in the Lough in recent years as the algae undergoes a surge in growth in warm weather.If this growth is not kept under control then Lough Neagh could become a dead sea,void of fish.In recent years the government has fitted major sewage works with phosphate reduction equipment.Last year was the first year since 1976 that the algae levels had not increased.
